intro: Phanerophlebia fortunei var. clivicola, commonly known as the cliff ivy, is a climbing plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in rocky or cliff environments, often growing on vertical surfaces. Its adaptability to harsh conditions makes it an interesting subject for botanical study.
